channel.title: C# - Recent Files
channel.description:
Well, I was asked to make this for somebody, so I spent about 5 minutes and did it. I thought maybe someone from here could find use of it. It's very simple - You open an item, it stays in a list. The list can hold 10 items (easily changeable). When you open that item, it gets moved to the top. When you open an item that's already in that list, it as well gets moved to the top. Very simple.
[url=http://www.mediafire.com/?b9oa1zn3xngcwvc]Download[/url]
Note it does not check if a file exists when you go to open it, only when you start up the program. It should be very easy to add.
~Lin

item.title: C# - Recent Files
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:2, topic:377379”]I am not saying this isn’t useful, but isn’t it basically the same thing that’s in the start menu?[/quote]No. This is used in a lot of software, such as any IDE you find, Guitar Pro, and most programs that deal with opening files of choice. It’s the same thing as that. Here, I’ll get a screenshot.

Read full topic
